page.title: 07COLESBOURNE GENERAL VIEW.
page.content: Colesbourne is a small Cotswold village situated in the Churn valley (160 metres above sea level) 6 miles south east of Cheltenham and 8 miles north east of Cirencester. Colesbourne is in the parlimentary constituency of {Tewkesbury and Cirencester.}The present Member Of Parliament is Nicholas Ridley, who is Minister of Transport. The population of Colesbourne is 112. There is no Doctor's surgery held in the village the nearest surgery is at Rendcomb.The village has a combined general stores and post office and a mobile wet fish tradesman visits every week. There are five council bungalows, five privately owned houses and between twenty-six and thirty tied houses and cottages or houses.
